lines.text: You can't lose 'em all.
You must play as if there's no tomorrow.
In this world only the strong survive. The weak get crushed like insects.
Would you marry me?
Well, it wouldn't be very practical, David.
Practical? No, of course not. Of course not. But then neither am I, Gillian. Neither am I. I'm not very practical at all.
You'll miss the plane!
It's sweet of you, David. I don't know what to say.
The stars, Gillian darling! Ask the stars!
[repeated line]
It's a mystery.
How do you feel?
I'm shocked, stunned and amazed.
Religion is nonsense.
It's also a gold mine if you know where to dig.
America. You know, land of the free, home of the brave. You know, Mickey Mouse.
It's a tough game, isn't it Roger?
It's a bloodsport.
Rachmaninov? Are you sure?
Kind of. I'm not really sure about anything.
The Rach 3. It's monumental.
It's a mountain. The hardest piece you could everest play.
No-one will love you like me, no-one like me.
Your first concert in years and you wear odd shoes.
No one's ever been mad enough to attempt the Rach Three.
Am I mad enough, professor? Am I?
The page! For God's sake, the notes!
I'm sorry sir, I keep forgetting the notes.
Will it be asking too much to learn them first?
[Gillian has come to visit Sylvia. When they arrive home, the house is in a mess and loud music is playing]
Is that the water running?
[Sylvia runs to the bathroom to find the shower running and the basin overflowing]
David? Where in God's heaven is he?
